snippet: President Obama warned of taking future steps against Egypt but made no mention of cutting off $1.5 billion in military and economic aid to the country.
abstract: Pres Obama says United States has canceled longstanding joint military exercises with Egyptian Army set for September, move that effectively rebukes Egypt's military-backed government for its brutal crackdown on supporters of Mohamed Morsi; decision lays bare Obama administration's limited options to curb military's campaign against Islamists and United States' role as increasingly frustrated bystander.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Chilmark, and Peter Baker from Washington. Eric Schmitt and Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: President Obama warned of taking future steps against Egypt but made no mention of cutting off $1.5 billion in military and economic aid to the country.

headline.main: His Options Few, Obama Rebukes Egypt’s Leaders
headline.print_headline: His Options Few, Obama Rebukes Egypt’s Leaders

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
